programme.title: Food Factory
programme.desc: A Toronto bakery prepares a mammoth order for one of the world's most prestigious hotels. Meanwhile, the overnight juicing team scrambles as a costly mistake puts them behind schedule.

programme.title: The Mating Game
programme.desc: The story behind the most fascinating, hilarious and dramatic quests to find a mate and leave a lasting legacy. Some species need to overcome the challenges of a vast environment just to find a member of the opposite sex. Others find themselves pitched against their neighbours in mass mating aggregations. Some must impress with complex displays. Others build extraordinary structures just to prove their worth. One thing, however, connects them all - the drive to succeed at all costs.

programme.desc: George Clarke follows people as they attempt to breathe new life into old properties. First up are Cornwall couple Richard and Sarah, who bought their former local high street bank for £50,000 and now face the challenge of converting the Victorian grade II-listed building into a unique family home.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: Paul Hollywood has put together three of the toughest bread challenges ever - a sweet dough with a twist, a steamy technical challenge, and a mighty final showstopper challenge.

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: Tonight, three chefs take on the terrifying prospect of tackling Marcus's crab omelette arnold bennett - they have 20 minutes to either hold their nerve or find themselves in a terrible scramble.

programme.title: Simply Italian
programme.desc: Michela heads to Italy to cook up ravioli, pappardelle, beetroot pasta and tortelli.

programme.title: Africa's Claws & Jaws
programme.desc: The harsh reality of life as a hunter is never knowing where your next meal is coming from. To survive, every predator must kill. Investigate the impressive weapons and attack strategies of Africa’s specialized predators.

programme.title: Africa's Claws & Jaws
programme.desc: Snakes, spiders, and scorpions are the kind of creepy crawlies many fear the most. But in Africa, these species are refined predators. Explore the hunting methods, special skills, and secret love lives of these venomous creatures.

programme.title: Africa's Claws & Jaws
programme.desc: Sharks are among the planet’s oldest and most highly evolved predators. Along the coast of southern Africa, pioneers dedicate their lives to learning more about these fascinating creatures and spreading awareness about their plight.

programme.title: Africa's Claws & Jaws
programme.desc: Lurking in the shadows of Africa is an incredible diversity of reptiles we seldom see. Masters of the underworld, these snakes and lizards have conquered almost every habitat on the continent while evolving a remarkable set of adaptations to survive.

programme.title: Battle Of The Alphas
programme.desc: With real-life dueling dragons, giant sumo-wrestling beetles, street-fighting monkeys, and sea turtles that play king of the hill - on top of another sea turtle, Southeast Asia boasts a wide range of wildlife warriors.

programme.title: Battle Of The Alphas
programme.desc: The USA is big on flash and spectacle. Bighorn rams rattle the mountaintops. Brown bears battle, desperate to fatten up for winter. Sharp-tailed grouse shake their tail-feathers on the dance floor. Wild stallions rumble with beauty and grace.

programme.title: Battle Of The Alphas
programme.desc: From the Highlands to the Alps, Europe’s evocative landscapes are the backdrop for epic wildlife drama. Normally stoic red deer go wild during the rut. Wolf packs clash over territory, and foxes do the foxtrot -- it’s not as nice as it sounds.

programme.title: Battle Of The Alphas
programme.desc: Wildebeest battle for herd hierarchy, meerkats live the thug life, floppy fish fight it out on land and locusts give up their vegetarian ways in a frenzy of cannibalism. It all happens on the wild and wide-open landscape of South Africa.

programme.title: Battle Of The Alphas
programme.desc: The latitudes south of the Sahara offer vastly different battlegrounds for a wide range of warriors. Male giraffes swing their heads like wrecking balls, zebras boast the most powerful kick in the animal kingdom, and chimpanzee warfare is eerily familiar.

programme.title: Battle Of The Alphas
programme.desc: From the Amazon to the Andes, South America has some beautiful scenery. From guanacos sparring over grassland, to marine iguanas head-butting over a beachhead, to home-stealing hermit crabs, the quest for real estate causes a lot of conflict.

programme.title: Baboons: Rules Of The Troop
programme.desc: Follow four different baboon families-a resourceful beach troop, the warlike desert troop, the disciplined river troop, and the peaceful mountain band-to find out why these primates are among the most successful animals in Africa.

programme.title: Wild Crusades
programme.desc: Hidden in the jungles of Sri Lanka is a charismatic monkey: the toque macaque. Each macaque is unique, from its facial features to social skills. With increasing human contact, see how the monkeys lives are being affected in unexpected ways.

programme.title: Coastal Africa
programme.desc: On the rocky southern tip of Africa lies a narrow peninsula held hostage by the elements. From pounding ice-cold waves to relentless sun, see how extreme conditions demand toughness and adaptability from its resident wildlife.

programme.title: Coastal Africa
programme.desc: Beneath the warm waters of the Indian Ocean lies a sanctuary filled with dazzling aquatic life. From witnessing a nesting turtle’s journey to meeting fish-cleaning shrimp, embark on a grand adventure into this amazing marine wilderness.

programme.title: New Kids In The Wild
programme.desc: Roam through South Africa’s Greater Kruger Park with a baby lioness and the pride that must fight off the predators threatening its territory. Will the cub learn the skills to hunt and survive the dangers hiding in the shadows?

programme.title: Africa's Hidden Kingdoms
programme.desc: A mountain range on the eastern side of Africa’s Great Escarpment is home to many creatures, but life here is no easy feat. The beauty of the range is matched only by its danger. Explore the soaring peaks and hostile landscapes of this iconic giant.

programme.title: Africa's Hidden Kingdoms
programme.desc: The plants and animals of the Cloud Mountains have long captured our imagination. In a landscape defined by weather and threatened by invaders, see how indigenous forests survive by providing a sanctuary for life while opening a door to the past.

programme.title: Africa's Hidden Kingdoms
programme.desc: A narrow and harsh belt of western coastline in southern Africa is a land of contrasts where creatures are forced to adapt to survive. Meet the quirky and charismatic inhabitants that call this fragile interplay between land and ocean home.

programme.title: Baby Animals
programme.desc: Watch fur seals give birth by the thousands, black bear cubs wrestle with their buddies, and meerkat pups forge bonds by sharing chores-all proving that growing up in the animal kingdom is easier when you have numbers on your side.

programme.title: Into The Wild India
programme.desc: The Ladakh plateau is a land of extremes, but the Tibetan wild ass is the king of this grassland. Follow one stallion as he shadows a herd of females for his chance to sire the next generation, but in doing so, he must battle those wanting his crown!

programme.title: Into The Wild India
programme.desc: In a land of searing heat and tropical storms, life on the plains of southern India is tough. But Bibi, a female sloth bear with two cubs, is up for the challenge of her life as she fights against drought, food scarcity, and predators around every corner.

programme.title: Into The Wild India
programme.desc: One of the most iconic animals on Earth stalks the jungles of India: the Bengal Tiger. Over the course of a single day, follow the fortunes of one mother and her three young cubs as she forages for food and fights to keep her family safe and alive.

programme.title: Into The Wild India
programme.desc: A young lion cub must survive as his family is torn apart, two adolescent leopard cubs must fend for themselves after they are abandoned, and a young adult blackbuck must risk life and limb as he tries to secure his first mating.

programme.title: Africa's Wild Year
programme.desc: Welcome spring’s arrival across Africa, and discover the life-giving gifts the season offers to the continent’s plant and animal life. Get a close-up look at animal families raising their young, and celebrate their emergence into the wider world.

programme.title: Africa's Wild Year
programme.desc: Journey thousands of miles and observe the extremes that summer brings to Africa, from droughts and famine in some locations to abundance and feasting in others. Discover how this season tests the limits of animals and plants across the continent.

programme.title: Africa's Wild Year
programme.desc: Track autumn’s arrival in Africa and the epic migrations it kicks off. Peer into nooks and crannies, where some creatures find one last romance before cooler weather descends, while others enjoy seasonal feasts ahead of the leaner winter months.

programme.title: Africa's Wild Year
programme.desc: Be an eyewitness to the death and resurrection that winter brings to Africa. Observe what comes with shorter days, from drought conditions to frigid winds, and marvel at the survival skills of animals and plants as they face the season’s fury.

programme.title: After The Wildfires
programme.desc: Charting the long-term recovery of wildlife in the aftermath of Australia’s catastrophic bushfires through stories of hope, human intervention and resilience, this film provides an urgent message to safeguard our environment before it is too late.

programme.title: Alaskan Summer
programme.desc: Discover the majesty of the US’s most northern state. Shot in stunning HDR, travel from the breathtaking coves and bays of Baranof Island, to the Glacier Bay where humpback and killer whales navigate among towering glaciers and soaring mountains.

programme.title: Wild Latin America
programme.desc: Follow the first months of a newborn humpback whale’s life in the waters off the Pacific Coast of Columbia. See how his mother nurtures him through sickness, supports his body, protects him under attack, and prepares him for an epic journey.

programme.title: Wild Latin America
programme.desc: Travel deep into the Columbian rainforest, where it’s mating season for one of the most clever monkey species in the world. Witness the most important time of year for male squirrel monkeys that have been bulking up to impress females for months.

programme.title: Wild Latin America
programme.desc: Get to know South America’s only bear species. Witness the shy and charismatic spectacled bear play, forage, and look for mates at the secluded Chaparri Ecological Reserve in Northern Peru.

programme.title: Africa's Hidden Kingdoms
programme.desc: For most of the year it’s a desert, but during early August and September the dusty valleys of Namaqualand transform into a wonderland carpeted with wildflowers. Witness this magnificent transformation from arid desert to beautiful oasis.

programme.title: Africa's Hidden Kingdoms
programme.desc: This small park makes a big difference to endangered animals. Offering sanctuary to some of the biggest and smallest animals on the planet, witness how species come back from the edge of extinction to reclaim their place in Africa’s wilderness.

programme.title: Africa's Hidden Kingdoms
programme.desc: Considered to be the most beautiful of the Cape’s protected areas, Kogelberg Nature Reserve has experienced minimal human interference. Discover the spectacular land and sea life flourishing in this unique botanical wonderland.

programme.title: Nature Scenes
programme.desc: One half hour of uninterrupted aerials of Arizona's canyons and the Vermillion Cliffs. Glide through these stunning rock formations and breathtaking views to discover the vast beauty of this landscape.

programme.title: Ol Pejeta Diaries
programme.desc: How close would you get to a wild lion? The staff members have to decide for themselves when a tricky job comes up: getting radio-transmitting collars onto a pride of these big cats in order to track their movements.

programme.title: Ol Pejeta Diaries
programme.desc: Ol Pejeta is home to both predators and prey. Observe the staff as they tackle their first ever hyena census. Will they be able to count these brilliant nocturnal hunters accurately and protect the animals living inside the reserve?

programme.title: Great Parks of Africa
programme.desc: Covering 1,600 square kilometres in South Africa, Addo Elephant National Park is home to far more species than its namesake animal. Meet many of its fascinating residents, including white rhinos, great white sharks, and adorable African penguins.

programme.title: Dogs With Extraordinary Jobs
programme.desc: Dogs around the world come to the rescue in surprising ways. Some search for survivors when disaster strikes or rescue animals from poachers and wildlife traffickers. Others help us in times of trouble-both on land and in the water.

programme.title: A Wild Year On Earth
programme.desc: In the early months of the year, the Earth’s axial tilt brings the height of summer in some places and the depths of winter in others. See how life struggles to survive under these extreme conditions.

programme.title: A Wild Year On Earth
programme.desc: Travel around the globe to witness the atmospheric shifts that take place in March, from the wave of cherry blossoms that unfold across Japan to the final raft of green sea turtles that arrive on the Great Barrier Reef islands to lay eggs.

programme.title: A Wild Year On Earth
programme.desc: Watch summer unfold in the Northern Hemisphere, while regions close to the equator enter the wet season and Southern Africa goes dry, creating scarcity for some creatures and bounty for others.

programme.title: America's Wild Seasons
programme.desc: Winter is the ultimate challenge for wildlife across America. Will they escape to milder southern climates or stay put and tough out the season? See how different creatures respond to the brutal cold and blizzards that blanket the North.

programme.title: Into The Wild Colombia
programme.desc: Meet Blanco, a young capuchin, living in the rainforest. Blanco’s home looks like paradise but he faces rival gangs and predators, including king vultures and jaguars, and must learn to find food. Can his family teach him before it’s too late?

programme.title: Into The Wild Colombia
programme.desc: Emblamatic of Columbia’s biodiversity, 150 species of hummingbirds can be found in its varied landscapes. Follow two mothers working to raise their young, a helmetcrest of the high altitude páramo, and an emerald hummingbird living in the rainforest.

programme.title: Dawn To Dusk
programme.desc: Live through a sunny tropical September day with creatures from Polynesia to the Indonesian archipelago. See how the sun affects the movement, feeding habits, and mating rituals of everything from tiny zooplankton to whale sharks.

programme.desc: One hour comprised of cute baby oryx from Miami Zoo, and antelope from Wild Florida. All animals were filmed in captivity.

programme.desc: The final 4 breeding-age white rhinos have settled in at Ol Pejeta. Can staff prepare them for the important task of raising a new generation to prevent extinction? Watch as the rhinos adapt to semi-wild life and begin to trust their instincts.

programme.desc: Grab a front row seat at one of the world’s few accessible lava lakes. Travel with a group to the geologically-active Danakil Depression in Ethiopia and visit the summit of one of the world’s most active volcanoes.

programme.desc: Harsh storms, wildfires, and heavy seas define Table Mountain National Park. Learn how its native animals and plants work together on the parched hillsides and windswept cliffs to form symbiotic partnerships that ensure mutual survival.
